00020 #include <sstream>
00021 #include <iomanip>
00022 
00023 #include <float.h>
00024 #include <cstdlib>
00025 #include <rdkcore/geometry/utils.h>
00026 #include "rpoint2od.h"
00027 
00028 using namespace RDK2::Geometry;
00029 using namespace std;
00030 
00031 namespace RDK2 { namespace RGeometry {
00032 
00033     RDK2_FACTORY(RPoint2od);
00034 
00035     RDK2::Object* RPoint2od::clone() const
00036     {
00037         return new RPoint2od(*this);
00038     }
00039 
00040     std::string RPoint2od::getStringRepresentation() const
00041     {
00042         ostringstream oss;
00043         oss << x << " " << y << " " << rad2deg(theta);
00044         return oss.str();
00045     }
00046 
00047     bool RPoint2od::loadFromStringRepresentation(const std::string& s)
00048     {
00049         istringstream iss(s);
00050         string a;
00051         iss >> x >> y >> a;
00052         if (a == "inf") theta = DBL_MAX;
00053         else theta = deg2rad(atof(a.c_str()));
00054         return iss;
00055     }
00056 
00057     std::string RPoint2od::getStringForVisualization() const
00058     {
00059         ostringstream oss;
00060         oss << setiosflags(ios::fixed) << setprecision(1);
00061         oss << x << " " << y << " " << rad2deg(theta) << "";
00062         return oss.str();
00063     }
00064 
00065     void RPoint2od::read(RDK2::Serialization::Reader*r)
00066         throw (RDK2::Serialization::ReadingException)
00067     {
00068         r->startReading(getClassName());
00069             RDK2::Object::readObjectBody ( r );
00070             x     = r->read_f64();
00071             y     = r->read_f64();
00072             theta = r->read_f64();
00073         r->doneReading();
00074     }
00075 
00076     void RPoint2od::write(RDK2::Serialization::Writer*w) const
00077         throw (RDK2::Serialization::WritingException)
00078     {
00079         w->startWriting(getClassName());
00080             RDK2::Object::writeObjectBody ( w );
00081             w->write_f64(x,"x");
00082             w->write_f64(y,"y");
00083             w->write_f64(theta,"theta");
00084         w->doneWriting();
00085     }
00086 
00087     std::vector<Object*>  RPoint2od::getTestCases() const {
00088         std::vector<Object*> v;
00089         v.push_back(new RPoint2od(1,0,0));
00090         v.push_back(new RPoint2od(2,0,RDK_INF64));
00091         v.push_back(new RPoint2od(3,0,RDK_NAN));
00092         v.push_back(new RPoint2od(4,RDK_NAN,0));
00093         return v;
00094     }
00095 
00096     // A NaN does not compare equal to any floating-point number or NaN, even if the latter
00097     // has an identical representation. One can therefore test whether a variable has a NaN value
00098     // by comparing it to itself (i.e. if x != x then x is NaN).
00099 
00100     bool  RPoint2od::equals(const Object*p) const {
00101         const RPoint2od * o = dynamic_cast<const RPoint2od*>(p);
00102         return o
00103             && ( (x!=x && (o->x!=o->x)) || (o->x == x))
00104             && ( (y!=y && (o->y!=o->y)) || (o->y == y))
00105             && ( ((theta!=theta) && (o->theta!=o->theta)) || (o->theta == theta));
00106     }
